text: Carroll County is the name of thirteen counties in the U.S.A. All, except for the one in Tennessee, are named after Charles Carroll of Carrollton, a signer of the U.S. Declaration of Independence from Maryland: * Carroll County, Arkansas * Carroll County, Georgia * Carroll County, Illinois * Carroll County, Indiana * Carroll County, Iowa * Carroll County, Kentucky * Carroll County, Maryland * Carroll County, Mississippi * Carroll County, Missouri * Carroll County, New Hampshire * Carroll County, Ohio * Carroll County, Tennessee, named after William Carroll, the sixth and ninth Governor of Tennessee * Carroll County, Virginia, officially named after Charles Carroll, though John Carroll, a Virginia state legislator, had tried to name it after himself ==See also== * "The Carroll County Accident", a 1968 country and western song written by Bob Ferguson and recorded by Porter Wagoner * East Carroll Parish, Louisiana * West Carroll Parish, Louisiana
title: Carroll County
